alert.note: Alert for Allen; Elk; Greenwood; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:34AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elk, Wilson, Neosho, Woodson, southern Greenwood and Allen Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 134 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Walnut to near Fredonia to near Grenola. Movement was south to southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Iola, Eureka, Neodesha, Fredonia, Humboldt, Yates Center, Erie, Howard, St. Paul, La Harpe, Gas, Moran, Thayer, Altoona, Moline, Longton, Toronto, Severy and Buffalo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Elk; Greenwood; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson
